result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Stauch Sarnowski

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant to court requesting to be released to go to the Ukraine to fight.  This request is respectfully denied. I have no authority to grant this request. I also have no evidence that Mr. Sarnowski is or could be a member of the armed forces, or that American troops are on the ground in Ukraine.  D.L.W.

12:30 PM Defendant Michael Stauch Sarnowski appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brian T. Kane appeared by video for Michael Stauch Sarnowski.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court addresses defenses motion to have bond reinstated.  State objects, makes statement. Atty Kane makes statement.  Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, denies request.
Bail/bond hearing on September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:31 PM Defendant Michael Stauch Sarnowski in court.  Attorney Brian T. Kane in court for Michael Stauch Sarnowski.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  Defendant enters no contest plea to cts. 1 & 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of cts.1 & 2. Counts 3-7 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court orders PSI.  State requests bond be revoked.  Defense objects, makes statement.  Court grants request, revokes bond.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court addresses bond modification request.  Defense requests cash bond be amended.  State objects, makes statement. Court denies request. All conditions remains as previously set.

10:07 AM Defendant Michael Stauch Sarnowski in court.  Attorney Brian T. Kane in court for Michael Stauch Sarnowski.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. This case following case 20Cf189 which is scheduled for trial.
Atty Kane Letter to Clerk of Courts
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

1:30 PM Defendant Michael Stauch Sarnowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian T. Kane in court for Michael Stauch Sarnowski. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

1:30 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Stauch Sarnowski appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brian T. Kane appeared by video for Michael Stauch Sarnowski.  Court reviews events in file.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, requests preliminary hearing be set.  Court sets PH on the record.  Bond remains in effect.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Stauch Sarnowski appeared by video from Door County Jail.  Atty Brian Kane appeared by video for Michael Sarnowski. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Court reschedules initial appearance based on statements made by defendant he isn't understanding. Bond remains in effect
Initial appearance scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact direct or indirect with A.J.B., her residence or place of employment. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

1:00 PM 1:00 PM Defendant Michael Stauch Sarnowski appeared by video from the Door County Jail.   Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brian Kane appeared for Michael Sarnowski by phone. Victim makes a statement. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
Initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
